short.am,ar,bg,bn,ca,cs,da,de,el,en,en_AU,en_G: Title Twister can reverse the order of elements in page titles to facilitate maintaining an overview of open tabs.

long.am,ar,bg,bn,ca,cs,da,de,el,en,en_AU,en_G:
This extension is meant to solve the problem that arises from some websites using page titles in reverse order of priority, such as "Website Name - Article Title" instead of "Article Title - Website Name".
When having multiple tabs open with different articles from the same site, it can then be easy to lose oversight of what tab is where and which tabs are still open.
Title Twister can fix this by turning a title like "Website: Article" into "Article | Website".

I noticed this being a problem when opening several tabs of the Unity 3D documentation, so I recommend using Title Twister for that purpose until Unity fixes their documentation titles in that regard. As an example you can use Title Twister for that by adding "docs.unity3d.com" as a target site. Title Twister will then automatically fix the titles of any new tabs loaded from the target site.
